description.narrative: Evidence-based and gender sensitive national and district-level planning and monitoring for health is strengthened to reflect up- dated and disaggregated data and bottlenecks analysis., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Child Health, Health Systems Strengthening, Maternal And Newborn Health. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 80% of pregnant women and children under five utilize quality high impact maternal, neonatal and young child survival services by 2018.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Evidence-based and gender sensitive national and district-level planning and monitoring for health is strengthened to reflect up- dated and disaggregated data and bottlenecks analysis.

description.narrative: Women and children in 16 districts received health services at health facility- and community-level following investments in decentralized evidence-based planning at district- and health facility-level. The RMNCH Score Card has played a pivotal role to advocate for gender mainstreaming in the health sector at national level. | Status:Met | As-of Date:22/12/2018

title.narrative: Number of districts that use data to prioritize investment for overcoming supply and demand sides system bottlenecks

Automated dashboards (including bottleneck analysis) scorecards, alerts and reports to support monitoring and enhance use of data to improve Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn, Adolescent and Child Health services
